{"step_by_step_thinking": "β-oxidation of fatty acids typically results in the production of Acetyl CoA. However, when odd-chain fatty acids undergo β-oxidation, the final three carbon fragment is cleaved off as Propionyl CoA, not Acetyl CoA which is a two carbon fragment. Therefore, the product of β-oxidation of odd-chain fatty acids is Propionyl CoA.", "answer_choice": "B"}
